metadata.dc:description: CASE REPORT Intrusion is defined as erosion and protrusion of the scleral implant into the vitreous cavity. This condition may occur as a retinal detachment, vitreous hemorrhage, endophthalmitis or be without symptoms. We performed a vitrectomy alone in a patient with relapsing vitreous hemorrhage secondary to the intrusion of a scleral buckle implanted 19 years previously and left intact the intruding buckle. DISCUSSION Intrusion of the scleral buckle is an uncommon complication of retinal detachment surgery. We discuss the management of scleral buckle intrusion.
metadata.dc:title: Intrusión de cerclaje escleral 19 años después.
[A scleral buckle intrusion 19 years after its use in retinal detachment surgery].
